Hi, I'm newbie on this. I started practicing kenjutsu and iaido with 
great effort and i love it, Well i'm want to buy my first katana, 
and i know you already got many of this questions but here is it. 

I'm looking for a cheap but useful katana to start with, i have not 
much budget so i'm trying to look something around $100 more or less
(i can try to afford more). I find this katanas but because i'm 
newbie i don't know which one are good. 

http://shopthroughtheages.com/unitedcutleryswords.html 
http://shopthroughtheages.com/paulchenswords.html 
http://shopthroughtheages.com/inhouseswords.html 

I don't know how the quality is or if they work for what i do. 

Right now my choice is the Paul Chen's Practical katana at $149 
Or the leather katana from united cutlery.. (also what do you think 
about the full tang?) cheaper but if it works it's ok for me. I want 
to start with something that feels real, i practice a lot with the 
bokken but you all know its weight is lots less than a real katana. 
If there's any other type, brand or store that you can recommend i 
will really appreciate it. 

Thanks for your time. 


*That samurai 3000 katana looks so cheesy don't you think? lol.
